content.raw:
When I read that I have the following assumptions:

* foo.h only includes the necessary headers, such as types needed in the API definition, like `sdf.hh` for any physics functions that have a `Load(sdf::ElementPtr)`. In that case, foo.c wouldn't need to re-include `sdf.hh`.

General types used in the API are pretty stable, but one of the reasons we use private PIMPL headers is so they don't have to be stable. So I would be willing to depend on includes in `foo.h` but not `foo_private.h`

Does that make sense?
